title: Research
text:
Research interests

Causal inference for decision-making (treatment effects, policy evaluation, uplift)

Machine learning with calibrated uncertainty

Interpretability and counterfactual explanations

title: Research
text:
Talks / community

Add talks, posters, seminars, workshops (even internal research seminars).

title: Projects
text: Below are projects selected to match Research Scientist (Causal Inference + ML) roles: problem framing, clean methodology, and decision relevance.

title: Projects
text:
1) Causal Inference: Estimating Treatment Effects (template)

Goal. Estimate the causal impact of an intervention (e.g., a feature rollout or creator program) on an outcome metric.
What I show. - Causal graph (DAG) and identification assumptions
- Estimation (e.g., propensity scores, doubly robust / DML)
- Sensitivity analysis and robustness checks
- “So what?” section: what decision changes
Artifacts. - Notebook: projects/causal_ate.ipynb (add your link)
- Short write-up: posts/causal-inference-dags.qmd

title: Projects
section: 2) Music market analysis using Spotify Web API (MSc thesis)
text:
2) Music market analysis using Spotify Web API (MSc thesis)

Goal. Identify audio + market patterns associated with “hit” outcomes and translate them into decision support for record labels.
What I show. - Data collection via Spotify Web API
- Supervised + unsupervised ML (feature engineering, evaluation)
- Practical interpretation for A&R / marketing decisions
Artifacts. - Repo / report link:

title: Projects
text:
3) Open-source: PEAXAI (R package) (if public)

Goal. Provide reproducible tools for probabilistic efficiency analysis + explainability.
What I show. - Package docs + examples
- Testing / CI (optional)
- Reproducibility principles
Artifacts. - CRAN / GitHub link: 


Tips (to keep it “Spotify style”)

One paragraph per project: problem → method → result → decision

Prefer 2–4 strong projects over many weak ones

Link to code + a 1-page explanation (PDF or post)

title: About
text: PhD candidate in Statistics, Optimization and Applied Mathematics (UMH). I work on ML methods that support transparent decision-making under uncertainty, with a particular interest in causal inference and counterfactual recommendations.

title: About

title: About
text:
What I’m looking for
A Research Scientist internship where I can build causal tools that help teams make better decisions, ideally in the intersection of creators, users, and product.

title: Notes
text:
Short notes explaining methods in a product-oriented way (what it is, why it matters, how to use it).

title: Causal inference with DAGs (a practical template)
text: When a metric changes, we want to know whether an intervention caused it, not just whether it correlates.

title: Causal inference with DAGs (a practical template)
text: When a metric changes, we want to know whether an intervention caused it, not just whether it correlates.

title: Causal inference with DAGs (a practical template)
text:
A minimal DAG workflow

Define treatment T, outcome Y, and pre-treatment covariates X

Draw a DAG capturing your assumptions

Identify a valid adjustment set

Estimate the effect (e.g., DR / DML)

Stress-test assumptions (sensitivity)

title: Causal inference with DAGs (a practical template)
section: What I’d report to a product team
text:
What I’d report to a product team

Estimated effect size + uncertainty

What assumptions are required

What could break the conclusion

Recommended decision (and safe next experiment)


Replace this post with your own write-up and link to the corresponding notebook/repo.

title: Home
text:
I’m a PhD candidate in Statistics / Applied Mathematics (grad. 2027) working on machine learning for decision-making under uncertainty, interpretability, and actionable recommendations.
Target role: Research Scientist Intern (Causal Inference & ML) — Summer 2026
Location: London (3 days/week on-site)

title: Home
text:
Highlighted projects

Causal inference for product decisions — treatment effects, sensitivity checks, and actionable recommendations.
→ See Projects.
Music market analysis using Spotify Web API — audio features, unsupervised + supervised ML, decision support for record labels.
→ See Projects.
Open-source — PEAXAI (R package) + reproducible pipelines.
